paper.title: Status of Early SuperKEKB Phase-3 Commissioning
paper.abstract: SuperKEKB is an asymmetric energy electron-positron collider for B-meson physics experiment. The beam collision with 3mm vertical beta function at the interaction point is confirmed during prior beam commissioning until July 2018. The next beam commissioning with the inner silicon vertex detectors so called "phase-3 commissioning" will start in March 2019. In the early part of next phase-3 commissioning, we plan to try the collision operation with over 1A stored beam current in order to exceed 1 x 10^34 cm^-2 s^-1 luminosity. We will report the preliminary results of the early stage of the SuperKEKB phase-3 commissioning.

paper.title: The 2018 Heavy-Ion Run of the LHC
paper.abstract: The fourth one-month Pb-Pb collision run brought LHC Run 2 to an end in December 2018. Following the tendency to reduce dependence on the configuration of the preceding proton run, a completely new optics cycle with the strongest ever focussing at the ALICE and LHCb experiments was designed and rapidly implemented, demonstrating the maturity of the collider's operating modes. Beam-loss monitor thresholds were carefully adjusted to provide optimal protection from the multiple loss mechanisms in heavy-ion operation. A switch from a basic bunch-spacing of 100 ns to 75 ns was made as the beam became available from the injector chain. A new record luminosity, 6 times the original design and close to the operating value proposed for HL-LHC, provided validation of the strategy for mitigating quenches due to bound-free pair production (BFPP) at the interaction points of the ATLAS and CMS experiments. Most of the beam parameters of the HL-LHC Pb-Pb upgrade were attained during this run and the integrated luminosity goals for the first 10 years of LHC operation were substantially exceeded.

abstract_log.comments:
Dear Author your contribution has been edited to meet the standard of JACow, Please find comments below:
(*)hyperlink were removed (*) ref 20 was before ref 19 in the text swapped refs in the bibli to fix this (*) removed vertical line in the table and fixed the spacing (*) some \murad units in the text and table were in italics, change them to normal text (*) Ref 15 was during the 9th workshop instead of the 10th from the original document (mistake from your part?) (*) Editted some of the refs to meet JACoW standard (*) Please upload the pdf file and check my changes for you final approval to move the document from yellow status to green status
Regards Fhumulani
It's a pity to de-activate the URLs in the bibliography, it makes the paper much less useful. But I accept.

Dear Speaker, The PDF of your talk has been processed, with backup slides removed, and will be published in the conference proceedings. In the event of a problem, please contact: jan.chrin@psi.ch Thank you.
New files uploaded by author verified for publication in proceedings.

paper.title: First Results of the Compensation of the Beam-Beam Effect with DC Wires in the LHC
paper.abstract: The compensation of the long-range beam-beam interactions using DC wires is presently under study as an option for enhancing the machine performance in the frame of the High-Luminosity LHC project (HL-LHC). The original idea dates back more than 15 years. After the installation of four wire prototypes in the LHC in 2018, a successful experimental campaign was performed during the last months. The experimental setup and the main results are reported in this paper.
